result.execSummary:
The defendant Harry Adrian Heisel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
*Defendant informed that if he completes all of his requirements of probation early, the defendant may be released early from probation.
*Review hearing scheduled for 12/18/15 at 1:30pm.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
*Pay supervision fees.

*NO contact with firearms.
*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*NO contact with victim unless approved by the court.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Complete Batterer's Intervention program.
*Attend treatment an/or counseling as determined.

*AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
*Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harry Adrian Heisel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Harry Adrian Heisel in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Harry Adrian Heisel in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab  
As to count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
.
Parties are proceeding to sentencing.
.
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 
 Court sentenced the defendant to serve 80 days in the House of Correction with credit for -0- days served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 15 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees

As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.

Defendant informed that if he completes all of his requirements of probation early, the defendant may be released early from probation.
.

Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Harry Adrian Heisel in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  cab
 Final pretrial conference held.  Defense counsel is requesting that the jury trial date be converted to a plea date.
Court grants his request.
Case calendared for a plea hearing in Branch 36 on 09/09/2015 at 08:30 a.m.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harry Adrian Heisel in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. State motioned for adjournment of the trial date. Court GRANTED state's request.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case st for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial in branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn

Defendant Harry Adrian Heisel in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for  Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harry Adrian Heisel in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Status Conference. Defense requests an adjourned Status Conference. Court granted. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM005510  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01/30/2015

Defendant Harry Adriana Meisel in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant reported to public defender office and does qualify for public defender representation. Court adjourns case for status of counsel date in Branch 23 to allow counsel to be appointed.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KCP.

Defendant Harry Adrian Heisel in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch23*.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
$300 cash bail posted at Greenfield Police Department
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1-23-2015 at 1:30pm
